Arcane Protection.name: Arcane Protection
Arcane Protection.description:
Arcane Protection

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Arcane Protection]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: 1

Range: Smarts

Duration: 5

School: Abjuration

Trappings: Concentration, a dull glow around the protected character, a fetish.

Success with arcane protection means hostile powers suffer a −2 penalty (−4 with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}) to affect this character. If the power causes harm, damage is also reduced a like amount.

Arcane protection stacks with @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Arcane Resistance]{Arcane Resistance} should the recipient have both!

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Additional Recipients (+1): The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional Power Point each.
  • Greater ARCANE PROTECTION (+2): Hostile powers suffer a −4 penalty (−6 with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}).
Arcane Protection.trapping: Concentration, a dull glow around the protected character, a fetish

Baleful Polymorph.name: Baleful Polymorph
Baleful Polymorph.description:
Baleful Polymorph

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Baleful Polymorph]{here}.

Rank: Veteran

Power Points: 3+2 per point of size change

Range: Smarts

Duration: 5

School: Transmutation

Trappings: Cursed artifact, a bolt of energy.

Choose a creature with the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Animal (Type)]{Animal} type, from @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Size –2 to Size 3}. Baleful Polymorph is an @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{opposed roll} of the character's arcane skill versus the target's @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Spirit}. With a success, the victim changes into a relatively harmless creature. They gain the @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Agility}, @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Strength}, @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Vigor}, and innate abilities of the animal, but retain their own @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Smarts} and Spirit.

The target must be able to survive in its current environment while in its new form (you cannot turn someone into a fish while on dry land). If the victim @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{critically fails} the Spirit roll, they gain the Smarts of the animal as well, believing that they are an animal until the power ends. At the end of each of the victim's subsequent turns, he can make a Spirit roll at –2 (–4 if the caster got a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}) to return to his normal form.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Duration (+2): The power's @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{Duration} is measured in minutes instead of rounds.
Baleful Polymorph.trapping: Cursed artifact, a bolt of energy.

Banish.name: Banish
Banish.description:
Banish

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Banish]{here}.

Rank: Veteran

Power Points: 3

Range: Smarts

Duration: Instant

School: Abjuration

Trappings: Holy items, arcane symbols, handful of salt.

Banish sends entities from other planes back to their native dimensions. This includes ghosts, demons, elementals, and similar beings (at the GM’s discretion).

Banishing a being is an opposed roll of the caster’s arcane skill versus the target’s Spirit. Success means the target is @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Shaken}, and each @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise} causes a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Wound}.

If this @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Incapacitates} the target it returns to its native plane of existence. Banished entities may return when the Game Master feels it’s appropriate, or even a few rounds later if the being has the ability to travel between planes on its own!

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Area of Effect (+1/+2/+3): The power affects everything in a Small, Medium, or Large Blast Template. See @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{area effect attacks} here.
Banish.trapping: Holy items, arcane symbols, handful of salt

Barrier.name: Barrier
Barrier.description:
Barrier

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Barrier]{here}.

Rank: Seasoned

Power Points: 2

Range: Smarts

Duration: 5

School: Conjuration

Trappings: Fire, ice, thorns, bones, energy.

Barrier creates a straight wall 5″ (10 yards) long and 1″ (two yards) tall, of immobile material that conforms to the surface it’s cast upon. Double the length with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}.

Thickness varies depending on what the wall is made of, but is usually a few inches.

The wall is Hardness 10 (or 12 with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}), and may be destroyed as any other object (see @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Breaking Things}). Each @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Wound} destroys a 1" (2 yard) square section of wall (piercing weapons can't damage the barrier).

When the spell expires or the wall is broken it crumbles to dust or dissipates. Trap­pings are never left behind.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Damage (+0/+1): The barrier causes 2d4 damage to anyone who contacts it. If the barrier is immaterial, such as with a wall of fire, this modifier costs +0 instead of +1.
  • Deadly (+2): The barrier causes 2d6 damage.
  • Hardened (+1): The wall is Hardness 12 (or 14 with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}).
  • Shaped (+1): The barrier forms a circle, square, or rectangle. It can't have a roof or floor, and can't Bind or Entangle anything within (use the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Entangle]{entangle} power for that).
  • Size (+1): The length and height of the barrier doubles.
Barrier.trapping: Fire, ice, thorns, force, bones, energy.

Beast Friend.name: Beast Friend
Beast Friend.description:
Beast Friend

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Beast Friend]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: Special

Range: Smarts

Duration: 10 minutes

School: Enchantment

Trappings: The caster concentrates and gestures with his hands.

This spell allows an individual to speak with and guide the actions of nature’s beasts. The cost to cast is equal to the sum of their @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Size} (minimum 1 per creature; see the creatures in @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore08bestia.JournalEntryPage.08bestiary000000]{Bestiary} for an example). Controlling five wolves (Size −1) costs 5 points, for example. Controlling a rhino (Size 5) also costs 5 points.

Success means the creatures obey simple commands, like a well-trained dog. They attack foes and endanger their lives for their master. A @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise} on the arcane skill roll means the beasts are more obedient. They won’t kill themselves but overcome their natural fears (fire, fearful creatures, et.) to follow their orders.

Swarms can also be con­trolled. Small Swarms cost 1 point, Medium Swarms cost 2, and Large Swarms cost 3.

Beast friend works only on natural creatures with animal intelligence, not humanoids, and has no effect on conjured, magical, or otherwise “unnatural” animals.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • BESTIARIUM (+2): The caster may affect magical beasts with animal intelligence.
  • Duration (+1): The base Duration increases to 30 minutes.
  • Mind Rider (+1): The caster can communicate and sense through any of the beasts he currently has befriended.
Beast Friend.trapping: The caster concentrates and gestures with his hands.

Blast.name: Blast
Blast.description:
Blast

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Blast]{here}.

Rank: Seasoned

Power Points: 3

Range: Smarts ×2

Duration: Instant

School: Evocation

Trappings: Balls of fire, ice, light, darkness, colored bolts, swarm of insects.

Blast launches a ball of explosive energy or matter. The area of effect is a Medium Blast Template. Every target within suffers 2d6 damage, or 3d6 with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise} (see @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Area Effect Attacks}).

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Area of Effect (+0/+1): The caster can make the blast a Small Blast Template for no extra cost, or a Large Blast Template for +1.
  • Damage (+2): The blast causes 3d6 damage (4d6 with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}).
  • GREATER BLAST (+4): The blast causes 4d6 damage (5d6 with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}) and is considered a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{Heavy Weapon}.
Blast.trapping: Balls of fire, ice, light, darkness, colored bolts, swarm of insects

Blind.name: Blind
Blind.description:
Blind

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Blind]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: 2

Range: Smarts

Duration: Instant

School: Necromancy

Trappings: Bright flash of light, sand in eyes, confusion.

Those affected by this malicious power suffer blurred vision or near-complete ­blindness with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}.

Success means the victim suffers a −2 penalty to all actions involving sight, or −4 with a raise.

The victim automatically tries to shake off the effect with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Vigor} roll as a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{free action} at the end of his following turns. @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Success} removes 2 points of penalties, and a raise removes the effect entirely.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Area of Effect (+2/+3): For +2 points the power affects everyone in a Medium Blast Template. For +3 points the area of effect is increased to a Large Blast Template. See area effect attacks @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{here}.
  • Strong (+1): The Vigor roll to shake off the effect is made at −2.
Blind.trapping: Bright flash of light, sand in eyes, confusion

Bolt.name: Bolt
Bolt.description:
Bolt

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Bolt]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: 1

Range: Smarts ×2

Duration: Instant

School: Evocation

Trappings: Fire, ice, light, darkness, colored bolts, a stream of insects.

Bolt sends damaging bursts of energy, streaks of holy light, or shards of matter toward one’s foes.

There are no @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{Range} penalties, but the arcane skill roll is affected by @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Cover}, @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Illumination}, and all other usual penalties.

The damage of the bolt is 2d6, or 3d6 with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Damage (+2): The bolt causes 3d6 damage (4d6 with a raise).
  • Disintegrate (+2): If the bolt @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Incapacitates} a creature, it must make a Vigor roll or its body turns to dust. If the target is an object, the caster rolls damage against its Hardness as usual (see @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Breaking Things}). If the bolt breaks the object, it disintegrates. Disintegrate allows the caster to roll bonus damage against objects and all damage dice can @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Ace}.
    Enchanted Items: The Hardness of enchanted items is doubled for the purposes of being disintegrated.
  • GREATER BOLT (+4): The bolt causes 4d6 damage (5d6 with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}) and is considered a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{Heavy Weapon}.
  • Rate of Fire (+2): The bolt attack is made at @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{Rate of Fire} 2.
Bolt.trapping: Fire, ice, light, darkness, colored bolts, a stream of insects

Boost/Lower Trait.name: Boost/Lower Trait
Boost/Lower Trait.description:
Boost/Lower Trait

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Boost/Lower Trait]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: 2

Range: Smarts

Duration: 5 (boost); Instant (lower)

School: Transmutation (boost); Necromancy

Trappings: Physical change, glowing aura, potions.

This power allows a character to increase or decrease a target’s @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Trait} (attribute or skill).

Boosting an ally’s Trait increases the selected Trait one die type, or two with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}.

Lowering an enemy’s Trait has a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{Duration} of Instant and lowers the selected attribute or skill a die type with @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{success}, or two with a raise (to a minimum of d4). A victim automatically tries to shake off the effect with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Spirit} roll as a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{free action} at the end of his following turns. Success improves the effect one die type, and a raise removes the effect entirely.

Additional castings don’t stack on a single Trait (take the highest), but may affect different Traits.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Additional Recipients (+1): The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional Power Point each.
  • GREATER BOOST/LOWER TRAIT (+2): With success, the selected Trait gains a free reroll once per round, or once per action with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}. For lower Trait the target applies a −2 penalty to the affected Trait’s rolls.
  • Strong (+1): Lower Trait only. The Spirit roll to shake off the effect is made at −2.

Burrow.name: Burrow
Burrow.description:
Burrow

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Burrow]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: 2

Range: Smarts

Duration: 5

School: Conjuration

Trappings: Dissolving into the earth and appearing elsewhere, a body of sand.

Burrow allows the recipient to meld into raw earth. He can remain underground if he wants or burrow through the ground at half his normal Pace (or full Pace with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}). He may not run.

A burrowing character may attempt to surprise a foe by making an opposed @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Stealth]{Stealth} versus @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Notice]{Notice} roll. If the burrower wins, the target is @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Vulnerable} to him only. With a raise, the burrower gets @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{the Drop}. Targets on @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Hold} may attempt to interrupt the attack before it occurs.

Burrowers can’t usually surprise a foe once their presence is known, but can still burrow for protection and mobility.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Additional Recipients (+1): The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Point} each.
  • Power (+1): The caster can burrow through stone, concrete, or similar substances. (Some substances, like glass, solid lead, etc., might be resistant at the GM’s discretion.)
Burrow.trapping: Dissolving into the earth and appearing elsewhere.

Burst.name: Burst
Burst.description:
Burst

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Burst]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: 2

Range: Cone or Stream Template

Duration: Instant

School: Evocation

Trappings: A shower of flames, light, or other matter or energy.

Burst produces a large fan of energy that bathes its targets in red-hot fire, a cone of cold, or other damaging matter or energy.

Success creates a Cone or Stream Template starting at the caster and extending outward (see @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Area Effect Attacks}). Everything within suffers 2d6 damage (or 3d6 with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}).

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Damage (+2): The burst causes 3d6 damage, or 4d6 with a raise.
  • GREATER BURST (+4): The burst causes 4d6 damage (5d6 with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}) and is considered a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{Heavy Weapon}.
Burst.trapping: A shower of flames, light or other matter of energy.

Confusion.name: Confusion
Confusion.description:
Confusion

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Confusion]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: 2

Range: Smarts

Duration: Instant

School: Enchantment

Trappings: Hypnotic lights, brief illusions, loud noises.

Confusion confounds all targets in a Medium Blast Template, making them either @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Distracted or Vulnerable}, or both with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}. The same effect applies to all those affected. These states are removed at the end of the victims’ next turn as usual.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Area of Effect (+0/+1): The caster can focus the confusion to a Small Blast Template for no extra cost, or a Large Blast Template for +1. See area effect attacks @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{here}.
  • GREATER CONFUSION (+2): On a success, targets are @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Shaken} in addition to being Distracted or Vulnerable (or both with a raise). Confusion is a non-damaging effect and cannot cause a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Wound} on an already Shaken target.
Confusion.duration: Until the end of the victim's next turn
Confusion.trapping: Light that forms the item’s silhouette, reaching into a magic bag, shaping dirt or clay into the item, pulling the item from a drawing or painting.

Conjure Item.name: Conjure Item
Conjure Item.description:
Conjure Item

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Conjure Item]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: 2 per pound

Range: Smarts

Duration: One hour

School: Conjuration

Trappings: Light that forms the item’s silhouette, reaching into a magic bag, shaping dirt or clay into the item, pulling the item from a drawing or painting.

The caster can create an object weighing up to one pound for every 2 Power Points spent. The item must be a simple, mundane object made of a common material (GM’s call) such as a 10-foot pole, blanket, shield, etc. A @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise} on the arcane skill roll produces an more durable version of the conjured item.

Conjured items appear in the hands of the caster or on the ground nearby. Once the @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{Duration} expires, the item fades from reality. This can cause issues, for example, if the conjured item holds a door open or was given as a gift.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Complete (+1): The object is a complete set, such as a chess set or a quiver of arrows. The set must fit under the weight limit.
  • Create Food and Water (Special): Instead of an object, every 1 @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Point} creates enough food and water to sustain a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Size} 0 humanoid for one day. The nourishing food is permanent (doesn’t disappear after you eat it), though it decays and is inedible after 24 hours if not consumed. The water is just like clean rainwater and does not spoil.
  • Durable (+1 per pound): The object’s @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{Duration} becomes “permanent” until dispelled. The Power Points are “invested” and unavailable until it’s destroyed, dispelled, or dismissed by the caster. The conjurer may dismiss the object at any time, regardless of sight, distance, or other factors. His Power Points then begin recharging normally.
Conjure Item.trapping: Light that forms the item’s silhouette, reaching into a magic bag, shaping dirt or clay into the item, pulling the item from a drawing or painting.

Curse.name: Curse
Curse.description:
Curse

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Curse]{here}.

Rank: Seasoned

Power Points: 5

Range: Touch

Duration: Special

School: Necromancy

Trappings: Effigy, ritualistic words, touch.

Some practitioners of the arcane arts heal their allies. Others inflict sickness upon their enemies. To use this particularly nasty spell, the caster makes an arcane skill roll Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.Opposed Rolls]{opposed} by the victim’s @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Spirit} roll. Failure means the victim suffers a level of @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Fatigue} immediately and at sunset each day thereafter (further castings of curse have no additional effect).

Once the accursed becomes @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Incapacitated}, he makes a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Vigor} roll each day to avoid death.

Breaking the Curse: The curse can be lifted by the original caster at will, and ends automatically if she’s slain. @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Dispel]{Dispel} also removes a curse (at −2), though each individual may only try once— if failed it’s beyond her abilities.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Turn to Stone (+5): The accursed must make a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Spirit} roll every round or take a level of @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Fatigue}. When @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Incapacitated}, the victim turns to stone (his Toughness becomes Hardness). The curse must be broken to stop the effect (see above).

Damage Field.name: Damage Field
Damage Field.description:
Damage Field

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Damage Field]{here}

Rank: Seasoned

Power Points: 4

Range: Smarts

Duration: 5

School: Abjuration

Trappings: Fiery aura, spikes, electrical field.

Damage field creates a dangerous aura around the recipient that harms foes foolish enough to get too close.

At the end of the affected character’s turn, all adjacent beings (including allies!) automatically take 2d4 damage.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Area of Effect (+2): The caster may extend the damage field into a Medium Blast Template centered on the recipient, the caster is immune to her own damage field.
  • Damage (+2): The damage field causes 2d6 damage.
  • GREATER DAMAGE FIELD (+4): The damage field causes 3d6 damage and is considered a Heavy Weapon.
  • Mobile (+2): Mobile works only with the Area of Effect modifier. It allows the caster to detach the damage field from the recipient and move it up to his Smarts die type each round as a limited @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{free action}.

Darksight.name: Darksight
Darksight.description:
Darksight

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Darksight]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: 1

Range: Smarts

Duration: One hour

School: Transmutation

Trappings: Glowing eyes, dilated pupils, sonic sight.

Darksight allows a hero to see in the dark. With success, he ignores up to 4 points of @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{illumination} penalties. With a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}, he ignores up to 6 points and can see in pitch darkness.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Additional Recipients (+1): The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Point} each.
  • Greater DARKSIGHT (+2): The recipient’s senses extend so far into the infrared and ultraviolet spectrums that he ignores all Illumination penalties and 4 points of penalties from @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Invisibility]{invisible} creatures.
Darksight.trapping: Glowing eyes, dilated pupils, sonic sight

Deflection.name: Deflection
Deflection.description:
Deflection

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Deflection]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: 2

Range: Smarts

Duration: 5

School: Abjuration

Trappings: Mystical shield, gust of wind, phantom servant that intercepts missiles.

Deflection powers work in a variety of ways. Some manifestations actually deflect incoming attacks, others blur the target’s form or produce illusionary effects. The end result is always the same, however— to misdirect incoming melee or missile attacks from the recipient of the power.

With success, foes must subtract 2 from either melee or ranged attacks (caster’s choice). With a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}, the penalty applies to both.

An attacker who uses a ranged weapon in melee against the recipient suffers the penalty either way.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Additional Recipients (+1): The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Point} each.
Deflection.trapping: Mystical shield, gust of wind, phantom servant that intercepts missiles

Destroy Undead.name: Destroy Undead
Destroy Undead.description: As an action, the cleric spends 2 Power Points to channel positive energy in a Medium Blast Template centered on herself. Every undead creature within the template must make a Spirit roll or take a Wound (this may be Soaked as usual).

Detect/Conceal Arcana.name: Detect/Conceal Arcana
Detect/Conceal Arcana.description:
Detect/Conceal Arcana

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Detect/Conceal Arcana]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: 2

Range: Smarts

Duration: 5 (detect); one hour (conceal)

School: Divination (detect); Illusion (conceal)

Trappings: Waving hands, whispered words.

Detect arcana allows the recipient of the power to see and detect all supernatural persons, objects, or effects in sight for five rounds. This includes @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Invisibility]{invisible} foes, enchantments on people or items, and so on. With a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}, the caster knows the type of enchantment as well.

When used on a supernatural creature, the caster learns its active powers and arcane abilities. With a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}, he knows @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Weakness]{Weaknesses} common to that creature type. This doesn’t reveal Weaknesses of unique individuals, if any. Those must usually be discovered through research or trial and error.

Invisible Creatures: Detect arcana also allows a character to ignore up to 4 points of penalties when attacking foes hidden by magical@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Light / Darkness]{darkness}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Invisibility]{invisibility}, or similar abilities (or all penalties with a raise).

Conceal arcana obscures one being or item of Normal Scale or smaller from the detect magic ability for one hour (see @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powers00000000]{Detect Magic} and the @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore08bestia.JournalEntryPage.08sizetable00000]{Size Table}). For larger creatures, increase the cost by the Scale Modifier (+2 PPs for Large, +4 PPs for Huge, or +6 PPs for Gargantuan).

With a success, attempts to detect arcana on the being or item suffer a –2 penalty or –4 with a raise. If detect arcana fails, the character cannot see through the ruse with this casting and is not aware it is concealed unless presented with obvious evidence of such (for example, the attack of an invisible foe).

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Additional Recipients (+1): The power may affect more than one viewer for detect, or item for conceal, for 1 additional @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Point} each.
  • Alignment Sense (+1): The caster can sense the presence and exact location of supernatural good or evil within range. Detect arcana activated with Alignment Sense no longer requires line of sight to locate creatures.
  • Area of Effect (+1/+2): Conceal only. The power affects everything in a sphere the size of a Medium Blast Template for +1 points, or a Large Blast Template for +2. See @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{area effect attacks}.
  • Identify (+1): The caster can identify a magic item’s powers and how they work.
  • Strong (+1): Conceal only. Detection rolls to see through the concealment are made at −2. This stacks with the additional penalty for casting with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}.

Disguise.name: Disguise
Disguise.description:
Disguise

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Disguise]{here}.

Rank: Seasoned

Power Points: 2

Range: Smarts

Duration: 10 minutes

School: Illusion

Trappings: Malleable features, illusionary appearance, hair of new form.

Disguise allows the target to assume the appearance of another person of the same @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Size} and shape, including clothing. It does not confer any abilities, however.

Those who have reason to question the imposter’s identity make a @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Notice]{Notice} roll at −2 to see through the disguise (−4 with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise} on the casting roll). This is a free action.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Additional Recipients (+1): The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Point} each.
  • Size (+1): The recipient may assume the shape of someone up to two Sizes larger or smaller than themselves.
Disguise.trapping: Malleable features, illusionary appearance, hair of new form

Dispel.name: Dispel
Dispel.description:
Dispel

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Dispel]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: 1

Range: Smarts

Duration: Instant

School: Abjuration

Trappings: Waving hands, whispered words.

Dispel allows a hero to negate enemy powers. It has no effect on permanent enchantments or natural abilities such as a dragon’s breath or a banshee’s scream. Dispel affects arcane devices normally (see @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05arcanedevice00]{Arcane Devices}).

Dispel can be used on a power already in effect or to counter an enemy power as it’s being used. The latter requires the countering mage to be on @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Hold} and interrupt his foe’s action.

In either case, dispelling an opponent’s power is an @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{opposed roll} of arcane skills. A target using the Mystic Powers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01edgesummarie00]{Edge} or @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Innate Powers]{innate powers} uses @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Spirit} as its arcane skill.

If the dispelling character wins, the targeted power ends immediately (or fails if it was countered with the usual results of failure). With a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}, the recipient of the dispelled power is also @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Distracted}.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Anti-Magic Field (+8): Instead of affecting a power at @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{Range}, this modifier creates a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Medium Blast Template} centered on the recipient with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{Duration} of 5. Magic items, effects, and powers have no effect within the field. Summoned creatures in the field must make a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Spirit} roll each round or take a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Wound}. Magically-created objects are unaffected. Anti-Magic Field has no effect on deities or artifacts, and can't be combined with any other modifiers.
  • Area of Effect (+1/+2/+3): The effect covers an area: +1 @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Points} uses a Small Blast Template, +2 points uses Medium, or +3 uses Large. See area effect attacks @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{here}. The caster makes one arcane skill roll and chooses which power on each target is affected. Targets oppose with arcane skill. This affects all powers in the target area unless the caster also uses the Selective @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{Power Modifier}.
  • Disenchant (+1): The caster can target a magical item rather than an individual or a power. This is a standard arcane skill roll, not an @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{opposed roll}, at −2 penalty (−4 for artifacts, GM’s call). If successful, all the item’s magical abilities are negated for one round, or two with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}.
  • Multiple Powers (+1): If successful, the caster dispels all the target’s currently activated powers.

Divination.name: Divination
Divination.description:
Divination

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Divination]{here}.

Rank: Seasoned

Power Points: 5

Range: Self

Duration: A brief conversation of about five minutes.

School: Divination

Trappings: Seances, demonic interrogation.

Divination allows the caster to contact other­worldly beings to gain information.

Preparing the spell takes one uninterrupted minute of prayer, coaxing or otherwise communing with a spirit or deity. Once that’s done, the caster makes her arcane skill roll. Success means the entity answers the character’s questions to the best of its ability. A @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise} means the spirit is more helpful, knowledgeable, or direct than usual (whether it wants to be or not).

Answers are typically vague or symbolic rather than direct— they provide clues and guidance rather than spoilers that ruin a mystery or adventure.

The type of entity contacted determines how it communicates. Spirits in the netherworld tend to know only those things pertinent to their life and death— and they may not even know the identity of their killer if the person was masked or unseen.

Likewise, nature spirits know only about their local environs, demons know only about the affairs they’re directly involved in, and so on. The Game Master must decide what the entity knows based on its background, origin, and personality.

Once a spirit has been conversed with it may not be contacted again for 24 hours. The Game Master may extend this to a community of spirits in a single place, such as water spirits in a babbling brook or nameless spirits in a mass grave.

Sacred Ground: Contacting a spirit on ground sacred to it (a deep forest for fey creatures, a temple for deities, a volcano for fire elementals or infernals, etc.) adds +2 to the roll.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Power (+3): This modifier works only on ground sacred to the entity the caster is attempting to contact— a deep forest for fey creatures, a temple for deities, a volcano for fire elementals or infernals, etc. The being may even manifest or appear in some form with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}.
    The entity not only answers the petitioner's questions but also offers unsolicited advice. Exactly what and how it's delivered depends on the entity. Woodland creatures may warn the caster about a dangerous area of the forest. A demon might gloat about a greater threat ahead, accidentally tipping some other entity's hand in a later encounter.
Divination.duration: A brief conversation of about five minutes

Drain Power Points.name: Drain Power Points
Drain Power Points.description:
Drain Power Points

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Drain Power Points]{here}.

Rank: Veteran

Power Points: 2

Range: Smarts

Duration: Instant

School: Necromancy

Trappings: Prayer, whispers, gestures.

Powerful mages, priests, and other arcanists can use this ability to drain magical energy from their foes. With a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise} they can even leech the stolen energy for themselves.

The power is opposed by the target’s @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Spirit}, and the caster suffers a −2 penalty to her roll if the target has a different Arcane Background than her own.

Success drains 1d6 of the rival’s @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Points} (if any, and the die doesn’t @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Ace}). With a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}, the caster adds the points to her own. This may take her above her usual maximum! They last until used, and must be the first spent when casting.

Drain Power Points can also be used on an arcane device (the creator still resists with her arcane skill whether she wields it or not). The device can’t lose more Power Points than it has.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Power (+2): The caster drains 2d6 Power Points with success.

Drain [[/r 1d6]] or [[/r 2d6]]

Elemental Manipulation.name: Elemental Manipulation
Elemental Manipulation.description:
Elemental Manipulation

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Elemental Manipulation]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: 1

Range: Smarts

Duration: 5

School: Transmutation

Trappings: A few simple gestures.

This power grants basic control over the four traditional elements: air, earth, fire, and water (the elements may vary for other cultures).

Here are some ideas for what each element can do. Each use is an action.

  • Air: Push someone (Str d6 or d8 with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}), blow out a torch, fan a flame, cool someone down (reroll a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Fatigue} roll in oppressive heat).
  • Earth: Move a square foot of earth (half that in stone) each round, cover tracks, hurl rocks at a target in Range for 2d4 damage.
  • Fire: Conjure flame about the size of a torch, hurl a small blast of fire at someone (2d4 damage), spread existing flame (see @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04hazards0000000]{Fire}).
  • Water: Conjure a quart of water (not “inside” objects or people), purify a gallon of water per casting, Push someone with a water spout (d6 Str or d8 with a raise).

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Power (+3): The volume of air, earth, fire, or water affected is tripled.
  • Weather (+5): The caster can summon or dispel storms, bring a cooling rain, scorch the earth with a heatwave, or even bring snow to the hottest climes.
    The caster can bring or disperse rain, snow, sun, and wind in about a five-mile radius. The severity depends on the local environment— a harsh desert might receive gentle rain while a rain forest gets a driving downpour. The effects take 10 minutes to create and last an hour.

Empathy.name: Empathy
Empathy.description:
Empathy

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Empathy]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: 1

Range: Smarts

Duration: 5

School: Enchantment

Trappings: Concentration, a sympathetic smile, exchanging a pleasantry.

A successful arcane skill vs Spirit roll gives the caster insight into a target's basic emotions. This grants him a +1 bonus (+2 with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}) to all @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Intimidation]{Intimidation}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Persuasion]{Persuasion}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Performance]{Performance}, or @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Taunt]{Taunt} rolls against the target for the @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{Duration} of the power. The bonus does not apply to skill rolls made to activate powers.

Empathy works on animals, adding +1 (+2 with a raise) to @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Riding]{Riding} or other rolls to interact with the creature.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Additional Recipients (+1): The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Point} each.
  • Charm (+2): If the target is Uncooperative or Neutral, a successful casting makes him Cooperative, or Friendly with a raise. The spell is instantly broken if the caster or her allies attack the victim or her allies.
  • DURATION (+1): Duration is measured in minutes instead of rounds. If the character @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Critically Fails} any of the affected skill rolls against the target, the effect terminates immediately.
  • Truth (+2): The caster knows if the target believes he's telling the truth or not.
Empathy.trapping: Concentration, a sympathetic smile, exchanging a  pleasantry.

Entangle.name: Entangle
Entangle.description:
Entangle

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Entangle]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: 2

Range: Smarts

Duration: Instant

School: Transmutation

Trappings: Glue bomb, vines, webs.

Entangle allows the caster to restrain a target with ice, bands of energy, or other vine-like Trappings (Hardness 8). If successful, the target is Entangled. With a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}, he’s Bound.

Victims may try to break free on their turn as detailed under @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Bound & Entangled}.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Area of Effect (+2/+3): For +2 points the power affects everyone in a Medium Blast Template. For +3 points the @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{area of effect} is increased to a Large Blast Template or use the Stream Template.
  • Damage (+2): Entangled targets take 2d4 damage at the end of their turn.
  • Deadly (+4): Entangled targets take 2d6 damage at the end of their turn.
  • Tough (+1): The entangling material is particularly resilient. Increase its Hardness to 10.

Environmental Protection.name: Environmental Protection
Environmental Protection.description:
Environmental Protection

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Environmental Protection]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: 2

Range: Smarts

Duration: One hour

School: Abjuration

Trappings: A mark on the forehead, potions, gills.

Adventurers sometimes travel beneath the waves, through planes of fire, or other @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04hazards0000000]{hazardous} environments. This power protects them from crushing depths, scathing heat, intense cold, and even radiation.

Environmental protection allows the target to breathe, speak, and move at his normal @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Pace} in an otherwise fatal environment. It protects him from intense heat, cold, radiation, pressure, and lack of oxygen.

A @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise} increases the Duration to eight hours.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Additional Recipients (+1): The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Point} each.
  • Environmental Resistance (+1): The power now offers environmental resistance, reducing damage from one energy source (fire, cold, electricity, etc.) by 4 (6 with a raise).
Environmental Protection.trapping: A mark on the forehead, potions, gills.

Farsight.name: Farsight
Farsight.description:
Farsight

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Farsight]{here}.

Rank: Seasoned

Power Points: 2

Range: Smarts

Duration: 5

School: Transmutation

Trappings: Invisibly marked targets, guiding winds, eagle eyes.

Farsight allows the recipient to see in detail over great distances. She can read lips or fine print up to a mile distant.

With a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}, she also halves @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{Range} penalties for @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Shooting]{Shooting}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Athletics]{Athletics} (throwing), or other abilities affected by Range.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Additional Recipients (+1): The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Point} each.
  • GREATER FARSIGHT (+2): Allows the recipient to ignore all @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{Range} penalties, and a raise doubles sight range.
Farsight.trapping: Invisibly marked targets, guiding winds, eagle eyes

Fear.name: Fear
Fear.description:
Fear

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Fear]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: 2

Range: Smarts

Duration: Instant

School: Necromancy

Trappings: Eldritch energy, cold chills.

This power causes overwhelming dread and horror. The target makes a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04fear0000000000]{Fear} check. @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Extras} who fail are Panicked and Wild Cards roll on the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-tables.Fear]{Fear Table}. If the power is cast with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}, the Fear roll is at −2 and Wild Cards add +2 to Fear Table results.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Area of Effect (+2/+3): For +2 points the power affects everyone in a Small or Medium Blast Template (caster's choice). For +3 points the area of effect is increased to a Large Blast Template.
  • GREATER FEAR (+2): Fear rolls are made at−2, or −4 if cast with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}.

Fly.name: Fly
Fly.description:
Fly

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Fly]{here}.

Rank: Veteran

Power Points: 3

Range: Smarts

Duration: 5

School: Transmutation

Trappings: Gusty winds, wings, broomsticks.

Fly allows a character to soar at Pace 12, or twice that with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise} (he may not run).

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Additional Recipients (+2): The power may affect more than one target for 2 additional @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Points} each.
  • SWIFT FLIGHT (+5): The base flying Pace increases to 24, or 48 with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}.

Growth/Shrink.name: Growth/Shrink
Growth/Shrink.description:
Growth/Shrink

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Growth/Shrink]{here}.

Rank: Seasoned

Power Points: 2 per point of Size change

Range: Smarts

Duration: 5

School: Transmutation

Trappings: Gestures, words of power, potions.

Growth increases the recipient’s Size by 1 for every 2 @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Points} spent. Each increase in Size grants the target a one-step increase to Strength and 1 point of Toughness (see @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Size} for more on Size). This does not increase @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Wounds} regardless of change to Scale.

Shrink reduces the Size of the subject one step for every 2 Power Points spent to a maximum of Size −2 (approximately the size of a cat). Each step reduced decreases @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Strength} one die type (minimum of d4) and Toughness by 1 (minimum of 2).

For unwilling targets, the caster’s arcane skill roll is opposed by Spirit.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Duration (+2): The power’s @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{Duration} is measured in minutes instead of rounds.
  • Power (+2): The target of shrink may retain her normal @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Strength} and Toughness while small.

Havoc.name: Havoc
Havoc.description:
Havoc

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Havoc]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: 2

Range: Smarts

Duration: Instant

School: Evocation

Trappings: Whirlwind, chaotic poltergeists, repulsion field.

This ability creates chaos and mischief for all those within its area of effect, hurling debris and rivals in all directions.

With success, the caster places a Medium Blast Template anywhere within @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{Range}, or a Cone Template emanating from the caster (see @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Area Effect Attacks}).

Anyone touched by the template is Distracted and must then make a Strength roll (at −2 if the caster got a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}). Those who fail are hurled 2d6″— directly away from the caster if using the Cone Template or directly away from the center if using a Blast Template (the caster chooses for those in the dead center).

Victims who strike a hard object (such as a wall) take 2d4 damage (nonlethal unless it’s a spiked wall or other more dangerous hazard).

Airborne Targets: Flying or airborne targets suffer an additional −2 to their Strength rolls as they have no ground to brace themselves on.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Area Effect (+1): Havoc affects a Large Blast Template.
  • GREATER HAVOC (+2): Targets are knocked back a total of 3d6” and take 2d6 damage if they strike a hard object.

Healing.name: Healing
Healing.description:
Healing

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Healing]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: 3

Range: Touch

Duration: Instant

School: Conjuration

Trappings: Laying on hands, touching the victim with a holy symbol, prayer.

Healing removes @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Wounds} less than an hour old. A success removes one Wound, and a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise} removes two. The power may be cast additional times to remove additional Wounds within that hour and as long as the healer has enough @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Points}.

For Extras, the GM must first determine if the ally is still alive (see @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03healing0000000]{Aftermath}). If so, a successful arcane skill roll returns the ally to action (@UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Shaken} if it matters.)

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Greater Healing (+10): Greater healing can restore any Wound, including those more than an hour old.
  • Crippling Injuries (+15): The power can heal a permanent Crippling Injury (see @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Incapacitation}). This requires an hour of preparation and only one casting is permitted per injury. If it fails, this caster cannot heal that particular injury (but someone else may try). If successful, the subject is Exhausted for 24 hours.
  • MASS HEALING (+2/+3): For +2 @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Points}, healing affects all allies within a Medium Blast Template centered on the caster (or a Large Blast Template for +3). See Area Effect Attacks @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{here}.
  • Neutralize Poison or Disease (+1): A successful healing roll negates any @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04hazards0000000]{poison} or @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04hazards0000000]{disease}. If the poison or disease has a bonus or penalty associated with it, the modifier applies to the arcane skill roll as well.
Healing.trapping: Laying on hands, touching the victim with a holy symbol, prayer

Illusion.name: Illusion
Illusion.description:
Illusion

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Illusion]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: 3

Range: Smarts

Duration: 5

School: Illusion

Trappings: Magical spells, holograms, “ethereal materializers.”

One of the greatest powers is the ability to create something from nothing— even if it’s not real!

Illusion can be used to create a visual scene or replica of most anything the caster can imagine, but it is silent, intangible, and incapable of affecting the real world. For example, illusionary weapons pass through foes, one cannot sit in an illusionary chair, and an illusionary dog has no audible bark.

Those who contact an illusion or doubt it’s real make a Smarts roll as a free action (at −2 if the power was activated with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}). If successful, that individual is no longer subject to this casting.

The GM should make group rolls for @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Extras} as they point out the illusion’s inconsistencies to each other.

The volume of the illusion must fit within a sphere the size of a Medium Blast Template (4″ or eight yards in diameter).

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Area of Effect (+1): The illusion’s area of effect is increased to the size of a Large Blast Template.
  • DEADLY ILLUSION (+3): The illusion may attack or otherwise cause harm. As a limited action, the caster may use the illusion to “attack” an individual. This is an opposed roll of the caster’s arcane skill versus the target’s Smarts (at −2 if the power was activated with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}).
    If the caster wins, the target is @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Shaken} (this cannot cause @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Incapacitation}). With a raise, the target suffers a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Wound} (this can cause Incapacitation). The caster may attack additional foes as @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Multi-Actions}. She may not use other combat maneuvers, such as @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Called Shots} or @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Wild Attacks} (though it may look that way!)
  • Duration (+2): The Duration is measured in minutes.
  • MOBILITY (+1/+2): For +1 Power Point, the illusion can move (and fly) at a Pace of 12, or 24 for +2 Power Points. This is a limited free action.
  • Sound (+1): The power generates sound appropriate to the illusion. Illusionary allies may talk, illusionary crows caw, and so on. It may not mask or mute existing sound, however.
  • Strong (+2): Smarts rolls to disbelieve the illusion are made at −2.

Intangibility.name: Intangibility
Intangibility.description:
Intangibility

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Intangibility]{here}.

Rank: Veteran

Power Points: 5

Range: Smarts

Duration: 5

School: Transmutation

Trappings: Ghost form, body of shadow, gaseous transformation.

With a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{successful} arcane skill roll, whoever receives this power becomes incorporeal. He is unable to affect the physical world, and it cannot affect him. He can travel through walls, and non-magical weapons pass straight through him. Any items carried at the time of casting are also incorporeal.

While incorporeal, the character may affect other incorporeal beings (including himself), and he is still susceptible to supernatural attacks, including powers and enchanted items. With a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise} on the activation roll, reduce the damage from supernatural attacks by 4.

The being becomes corporeal when the power ends, but if within someone or something he’s shunted to the nearest open space and @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Stunned}.

If cast on an unwilling target, the victim resists with @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Spirit}. If affected, he shakes off the effect with a Spirit roll as a free action at the end of his following turns.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Additional Recipients (+3): The power may affect more than one target for 3 additional @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Points} each.
  • Duration (+3): @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{Duration} is measured in minutes instead of rounds.
Intangibility.trapping: Ghost form, body of shadow, gaseous transformation

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description:
Invisibility

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Invisibility]{here}.

Rank: Seasoned

Power Points: 5

Range: Smarts

Duration: 5

School: Illusion

Trappings: Powder, potion, iridescent lights.

With a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{success}, the character and his personal items are transparent except for a vague blur or outline. Any action taken against him that requires sight is made at −4, or −6 with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}. The same penalty applies to Notice rolls to detect the unseen presence.

Reduce the penalty by 2 if the invisible character’s position is given away, such as moving in water, hit with mud or another substance that reveals her form, outside in the rain, etc.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Additional Recipients (+3): The power may affect more than one target for 3 additional @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Points} each.
  • Duration (+2): @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{Duration} is measured in minutes instead of rounds. If the character attempts a damage-causing attack or targets an unwilling character with a power, the effect terminates immediately.

Light / Darkness.name: Light / Darkness
Light / Darkness.description:
Light/Darkness

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Light / Darkness]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: 2

Range: Smarts

Duration: 10 minutes

School: Evocation

Trappings: Illusionary torch, sunlight, darkness, thick fogs.

Light creates bright illumination in a Large Blast Template. With a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}, the light can be focused into a 5″ (10 yard) beam as well.

Darkness blocks illumination in an area the size of a Large Blast Template, making the area Dark, or Pitch Dark with a raise (see @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Illumination}).

If light and darkness overlap, they create a patch of Dim light (−2).

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Area Effect (+2): Light only. The light expands to the caster’s @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Smarts} in radius, with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{Range} of Smarts ×2. The light is sunlight and acts as natural sunlight.
  • True DARKNESS (+2): The darkness blocks Infravison, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Low Light Vision]{Low Light Vision}, and @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Darkvision]{Darkvision}. It has no effect on magical sight such as @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Detect/Conceal Arcana]{detect arcana.}
  • Mobile (+1): The caster can move the template at a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Pace} equal to his arcane skill die type as a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{limited free action} each round. He can also attach it to an inanimate object when first cast if desired. It cannot be cast on a living being.
Light / Darkness.trapping: Illusionary torch, sunlight, darkness, thick fogs

Locate.name: Locate
Locate.description:
Locate

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Locate]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: 3

Range: Self

Duration: 10 minutes

School: Divination

Trappings: A floating crystal over a map, message in the clouds, a ray of light.

Sometimes it's literally impossible to find something via mundane means. Locate allows the caster to find these hidden things.

When casters use this power, they choose an object, creature, or location. If the caster has never seen the target, the roll is at −2. A success gives a sense of the general direction and distance of the target. A @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise} also gives an impression of the target (e.g., the creature is asleep, the object is in a strongbox, the secret door is behind a bookshelf).

Running Water: On Golarion, running water blocks locate if it’s in the path between the caster and the target.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Find the Path (+1): In addition to the direction and distance to a person, place, or thing, the caster also has a supernatural sense of the best or fastest way to navigate to the target’s general area.
Locate.trapping: A floating crystal over a map, message in the clouds, a ray of light.

Mind Link.name: Mind Link
Mind Link.description:
Mind Link

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Mind Link]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: 1

Range: Smarts

Duration: 30 minutes

School: Divination

Trappings: Headpieces, talismans to deities.

Mind link creates a telepathic connection between two individuals (which does not necessarily have to include the caster). The link accommodates only willing subjects and communication— thoughts that aren’t consciously transmitted aren’t relayed.

Once activated, the Range between all linked minds is one mile, or five with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}.

If any of the linked characters suffers a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Wound}, all others must make a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Smarts} roll or be @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Shaken} (this cannot cause a Wound).

The speed of communication is that of normal speech, but with a raise members may communicate up to 30 seconds or so of speech on a single combat turn.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Additional Recipients (+1): The power may affect additional individuals for 1 additional @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Point} each.
  • Broadcast (+2): The caster can broadcast a short telepathic message to every sentient mind within @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Smarts} ×4 radius (Smarts ×8 with a raise). The caster can only broadcast, she doesn’t receive their responses.
  • Long Distance LINK (+3): Casters can connect with any mind they're familiar with on the same plane of existence, regardless of distance.

Mind Reading.name: Mind Reading
Mind Reading.description:
Mind Reading

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Mind Reading]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: 2

Range: Smarts

Duration: Instant

School: Divination

Trappings: Psionic invasion, soulsight.

Mind reading is an opposed roll versus the target’s @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Smarts}. Success allows the character to gain one truthful answer from the subject. The target is aware of the mental intrusion unless the mind reader gets a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}. The GM may apply modifiers based on the subject’s mental Hindrances or current state of mind.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • MIND WALK (+2): The caster has greater access to the target’s mind and memories, unlocking an entire scene or chain of related memories (GM’s call).

Mind Wipe.name: Mind Wipe
Mind Wipe.description:
Mind Wipe

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Mind Wipe]{here}.

Rank: Veteran

Power Points: 3

Range: Smarts

Duration: Instant

School: Enchantment

Trappings: A noxious drink, parasites, touching the target’s temples.

Mind wipe removes a target’s memories, a terrible violation in most civilized societies. The power is opposed by a victim’s @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Smarts} and requires a full minute of mental struggle. The victim must be conscious during this time, so if not restrained he can simply move out of @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{Range}.

If successful, the victim forgets a single event (up to about 30 minutes of time). A @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise} removes a complex memory of several hours.

If the defender wins, the caster cannot affect him with mind wipe for 24 hours. (Others may reattempt the power, however.)

The memory remains missing, but strong evidence that challenges its “logic” allows a Smarts roll at −2 to remember fragments determined by the GM.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Edit (+1): Instead of wiping the memory, the caster edits it as she sees fit.
  • Fast Cast (+2): The caster can wipe a memory as an @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{action}.
  • GREATER MIND WIPE (+2): The effect completely removes a single event, person, place, thing, etc., from the victim’s memory.
Mind Wipe.trapping: A noxious drink, parasites, touching the target's temples

Object Reading.name: Object Reading
Object Reading.description:
Object Reading

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Object Reading]{here}.

Rank: Seasoned

Power Points: 2

Range: Touch

Duration: Special

School: Divination

Trappings: Touching the object, glowing hands

Object reading is the ability to get visions of the past from an object. With a successful casting, she gains a vague impression of whatever information she’s looking for, from the object’s creation forward. A @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise} grants her more specific information.

If the caster uses object reading on a bloody knife to investigate a murder, for example, success might tell her the wielder was a human and that the attack happened at night. With a raise, she might get a glimpse of the killer’s face or some other clue that to reveal his identity.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • PROJECTION (+2): The caster may broadcast the vision, projecting it out into a space the size of a small room. Anyone present may see and hear the events and examine the projection from all angles.

Planar Binding.name: Planar Binding
Planar Binding.description:
Planar Binding

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Planar Binding]{here}.

Rank: Veteran

Power Points: 8

Range: Smarts

Duration: Instant

School: Conjuration

Trappings: A summoning circle, an enchanted, iron casket, magical chains.

The caster summons a creature from another plane, trapping them in some sort of prison, such as a binding circle. The trap is created with chalk, salt, glyphs and wards, or other materials prior to the power's activation, and takes ten minutes to prepare.

Once the trap is prepared, the caster selects an Outsider to summon. She must know about the creature somehow, perhaps by previous encounter, access to books and scrolls, or an @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Occult]{Occult} roll with a modifier set by the Game Master. The caster can summon a specific entity if she knows its proper name.

Casting is an @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{opposed roll} between the caster's arcane skill and the entity's @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Spirit}. If the spell fails the entity knows who attempted to bind it. If the caster rolls a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Critical Failure}, the creature may appear if it chooses to and is unbound— it may do as it wishes and its abilities allow.

If the caster wins, the creature is summoned into the trap and magically bound there until it agrees to perform a service for the caster or breaks free (see below). The @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Points} used to bind the target are invested and unavailable until the creature breaks free or completes its task.
