Bargaining: Casters summon creatures to task them with a "service" of some sort, such as taking part in a difficult battle, acting as a bodyguard, or some difficult or unpleasant task. The negotiation can usually be handled through roleplaying (and perhaps a @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Persuasion]{Persuasion} or @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Intimidation]{Intimidation} roll).

Cunning creatures require more incentive. An evil being might ask for time to wander the earth and wreak havoc, a sacrifice, or some other "devil's bargain" proportional to the service required. A good or noble creature might aid the summoner without reward if the cause is just, or might require she perform some task for her followers or sphere of influence. Entities never agree to impossible or unreasonable demands.

Once the creature agrees to the terms, it must carry them out to the best of its ability. The caster does not have to live up to any promises she set— though entities might seek revenge if deceived or their kind are summoned too often. Casters must be wary of this, especially if the beings have a way back to the prime material plane!

Breaking Free: If no agreement is made after 24 hours, the caster must renew the mystic bonds by making another opposed roll of her arcane skill versus the creature's @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Spirit}. This continues every 24 hours until an agreement is reached or the creature breaks free. The entity can't use any other power or ability to escape.
Planar Binding.trapping: A summoning circle, an enchanted, iron casket, magical chains.

Plane Shift.name: Plane Shift
Plane Shift.description:
Plane Shift

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Plane Shift]{here}.

Rank: Veteran

Power Points: 4

Range: Smarts

Duration: Instant

School: Conjuration

Trappings: Cosmic hole in space, circle of magic runes.

Plane shift allows the caster to move directly to another plane of existence (see @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04theplanes00000]{here}). If plane shifting to a known location, a success indicates the target appears within 10d10 miles of the intended location. With a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}, the mage appears half that distance away.

If the caster doesn’t know exactly where he wants to go, he can research locations within that plane to target a specific city, geographic location, etc. Failure means he arrives at a completely random location on that plane. Success puts him in the general vicinity, and a raise puts him closer to the desired locale. This is in addition to the accuracy of the arcane skill roll.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Additional Recipients (+1): The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional Power Point each.
  • Extra-Dimensional Space (+1): Instead of traveling to a known plane, the recipient travels to a pocket dimension where he’s conjured a magical shelter or similar structure with basic necessities, food, and water for up to five people. The structure remains afterward, so the mage and his companions may return to this space or to a new one, as desired.
  • Transport Foe (+2): The caster sends an unwilling target to another plane or extra-dimensional space. The being resists the casting with a Spirit roll. If failed, he’s transported to another plane of the caster’s choice for three rounds (five rounds with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}) before returning (or as close as possible if the space is occupied).
Plane Shift.trapping: Cosmic hole in space, circle of magic runes

Protection.name: Protection
Protection.description:
Protection

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Protection]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: 2

Range: Smarts

Duration: 5

School: Abjuration

Trappings: A mystical glow, bark skin, mage armor, ethereal armor.

Protection creates a field of energy or armor around a character, giving him 2 points of Armor. With a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}, the bonus is applied to Toughness instead (and therefore immune to @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{Armor Piercing} modifiers).

Whether the protection is visible or not depends on the @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05trappings00000]{Trapping}— this is entirely up to the caster.

Protection stacks with all other armor, natural or worn.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Additional Recipients (+1): The power may affect additional targets at a cost of 1 @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Points} each.
Protection.trapping: A mystical glow, hardened skin, ethereal armor, a mass of nanites

Puppet.name: Puppet
Puppet.description:
Puppet

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Puppet]{here}.

Rank: Veteran

Power Points: 3

Range: Smarts

Duration: 5

School: Enchantment

Trappings: Glowing eyes, trance-like state, a swinging pocket watch, voodoo dolls.

Puppet is an @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{opposed roll} of the character’s arcane skill versus the target’s @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Spirit}. With success, the victim obeys commands that don’t directly harm himself or those he cares about. This includes inaction, as well, so a controlled character won't just stand idly by or leave the area if he knows his friends are in danger.

With a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}, the target will harm himself or others (including by inaction), but gets a Spirit roll as a free action. If successful, he doesn’t carry out that particular command but remains a puppet. With a raise, he breaks the controller’s hold and the power ends.

Commands are general, such as “attack that person” or “open that door.” The controller doesn’t get to dictate how many actions the victim uses in a turn, whether or not he uses his @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Sweep]{Sweep} Edge, etc.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Additional Recipients (+2): The caster may affect others at the cost of 2 @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Points} each.
  • Strong (+2): @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Spirit} rolls to resist commands are made at −2. If the caster also uses @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Mind Link]{mind link} on the target, she may extend her control of him to any distance, even out of her sight.
Puppet.trapping: Glowing eyes, trance-like state, a swinging pocket watch, voodoo dolls.

Relief.name: Relief
Relief.description:
Relief

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Relief]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: 1

Range: Smarts

Duration: Instant/One Hour

School: Conjuration

Trappings: Prayer, glowing hands, sparkling spirals of magic, a cool breeze.

Relief allows the caster to recover from a negative condition or the effects of @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Fatigue}.

Recover: The caster removes one of the following negative conditions: @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Shaken}, @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Distracted, or Vulnerable}. A @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise} on the arcane skill roll removes two conditions. If affecting more than one target (via the Additional Recipients modifier), the caster may choose which condition(s) to remove for each ally.

Relief can’t remove negative conditions caused by ongoing effects (@UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Bound or Entangled}, @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Stunned}, etc.) unless the source of the effect is removed.

Numb: Reduces the recipient’s total penalties from @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Wounds} and Fatigue by one with success, or two with a raise. An Exhausted (−2) hero with three Wounds (−3), for example, reduces her total −5 penalty to −4 with success, and −3 with a raise.

This effect lasts one hour. It doesn’t actually remove the Wounds or the Fatigue, it just allows the recipient to ignore the penalties. If the target would be @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Incapacitated} by Wounds or Fatigue, she’s still Incapacitated as usual.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Additional Recipients (+1): The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Point} each.
  • Restoration (+3): The caster can restore one die type from an energy draining effect with a success, two with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}. See @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Energy Drain]{Energy Drain}.
  • Stunned (+1): If using the Recover option, the caster may also affect the Stunned condition. This completely removes the effects of being @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Stunned}.
Relief.trapping: Prayer, Prayer, glowing hands, sparkling spirals of magic, a cool breeze.

Resurrection.name: Resurrection
Resurrection.description:
Resurrection

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Resurrection]{here}.

Rank: Heroic

Power Points: 20

Range: Touch

Duration: Instant

School: Conjuration

Trappings: Elaborate ceremonies, magical amulets, divine intervention

Perhaps the greatest power of all is the ability to bring someone back from the dead. It can restore lost loves, bring solace to the grieving, and topple kingdoms.

Returning the dead to life requires a reasonably complete corpse no more than a year old. The caster then prays, meditates, chants, or otherwise concentrates on mending the body and pulling the spirit back to it for four hours.

Once done, the healer makes a casting roll at −4. If successful, the victim returns to life with three @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Wounds} and is Exhausted. With a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}, she returns merely Exhausted.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Greater Resurrection (+10): The boundaries of life and death no longer matter. A caster can restore the dead to life regardless of how long the target was dead and even without a corpse. To resurrect the dead in this fashion requires a twelve-hour ritual and leaves the caster Exhausted.
  • Power (+5): The hero can raise a spirit dead up to a decade for +5 @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Points}.
Resurrection.trapping: Elaborate ceremonies, magical amulets, divine intervention

Sanctuary.name: Sanctuary
Sanctuary.description:
Sanctuary

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Sanctuary]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: 2

Range: Touch

Duration: 5

School: Enchantment

Trappings: Words of power, holy symbol, glowing light

Any evil creature attempting a damaging attack that targets or affects the recipient must make a Spirit roll (at −2 if cast with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}). If the roll fails, the creature loses that action.

If anyone under the effects of sanctuary attempts to harm a living being (evil or otherwise), he loses the benefit of sanctuary instantly.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • AREA EFFECT (+2/+3): For +2 points the power affects all allies within a Medium Blast Template centered on the recipient. For +3 points the area of effect is increased to a Large Blast Template. See area effect attacks @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{here}.
  • STRONG (+1): Spirit rolls by the creature are made at −2 (−4 with a raise).
Sanctuary.trapping: Words of power, holy symbol, glowing light

Scrying.name: Scrying
Scrying.description:
Scrying

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Scrying]{here}.

Rank: Seasoned

Power Points: 3

Range: Self

Duration: 5

School: Divination

Trappings: Images on a reflected surface, glowing eyes, a crystal ball.

Scrying allows the caster to secretly spy on a distant target. Preparing the spell takes one uninterrupted minute while the caster focuses on a target item, creature, or location. This makes her @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Vulnerable} and unable to take any other actions. If she's @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Shaken} or @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Stunned} during this time, the spell fails.

If the caster has never seen the target herself, she makes her arcane skill roll at −2. Scrying on a target in a different plane of existence also imposes a −2 penalty.

Scrying is opposed by the subject's @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Spirit}. If the target wins, he knows he's being spied on. If the caster wins, he can see and hear the target and the area around it but cannot move his perspective. With a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}, he can shift perspective and follow the target at a Pace 24.

A scrying "eye" may be seen with @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Detect/Conceal Arcana]{detect arcana} (but not detect magic). It may also be @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Dispel]{dispelled} (at –2 if suspected but not revealed).

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Group Sight (+1): The caster may share her perception with allies within a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{Range} of @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Smarts} for the power’s @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{Duration}.
Scrying.trapping: Images on a reflected surface, glowing eyes, a crystal ball.

Shape Change.name: Shape Change
Shape Change.description:
Shape Change

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Shape Change]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: Special

Range: Self

Duration: 5

School: Transmutation

Trappings: “Morphing,” talismans, tattoos.

This power allows the caster to take the form of one of the following creature types: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Animal (Type)]{Animal}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Elemental]{Elemental}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Humanoid (Type)]{Humanoid}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Plant (Type)]{Plant}. The caster can only turn into the base form of the creature, not elite or alternative versions (So a Troll is allowed, but a Troll Brute is not). With a raise, the caster can increase the creature's Strength and Vigor by one die type each. The size of the new form is limited by the caster's Rank:

What a character can change into depends on his Rank:

Held and worn items are assumed into the new form and reappear when the power ends. While transformed, the character retains his Edges and Hindrances, and his Smarts, Spirit, and their linked skills (though he may not be able to use some or all of them depending on the form—GM’s call). He gains the animal’s Agility, Strength, Vigor, and linked skills. His ability to use devices and communicate is limited to those of his new form. He can maintain powers and even cast new powers if the form permits (GM's call). Casting a power in the new form incurs a –2 penalty to the roll, modified by the difference in rank between the spellcaster and the rank required for his new form (see the Shape Change table). If the caster is one rank higher the penalty is –1, or 0 if two or more ranks higher.

A creature's natural abilities are conferred, but innate powers and Arcane Backgrounds aren't. A caster in the form of a copper dragon could fly and use its breath weapon, but not use its spellcasting ability.

Wound Effects: The caster cannot benefit from a creature's additional Wounds or Wound reduction abilities like Resilient, Very Resilient, or Unstoppable, or extra Wounds from Large or Huge Scale creatures.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Duration (+1): The power’s @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{Duration} is measured in minutes instead of rounds.
  • Transform (+2/+3): The power may affect a willing target at a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{Range} of Touch for +2 or Smarts for +3 (the Range Modifier may increase this further).

Sloth/Speed.name: Sloth/Speed
Sloth/Speed.description:
Sloth/Speed

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Sloth/Speed]{here}.

Rank: Seasoned

Power Points: 2

Range: Smarts

Duration: Instant (sloth); 5 (speed)

School: Transmutation

Trappings: Slowing time, blurred motion, a slippery patch of oil or ice.

Sloth lessens celerity and coordination. It halves the target’s total movement each round (round up). With a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}, movement is also an action. The target automatically attempts to shake off the effects of sloth at the end of each of his next turns by making a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Spirit} roll.

Speed doubles the target’s movement (basic @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Pace} and running). With a raise the character also ignores the −2 running penalty.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Additional Recipients (+1): Speed only. The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Point} each.
  • Area of Effect (+2/+3): Sloth only. For +2 points the power affects everyone in a Medium Blast Template. For +3 points the area of effect is increased to a Large Blast Template. See area effect attacks @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{here}.
  • Dash (+2): Speed only. The recipient’s running die isn't rolled— she gains the maximum result possible.
  • Quickness (+2): Speed only. The character’s total @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Multi-Action} penalty each turn is reduced by 2 (she can do two actions at no penalty or three at −2 each).
  • Strong (+1): Sloth only. The @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Spirit} roll to shake off sloth’s effects is made at −2.
Sloth/Speed.trapping: Slowing time, blurred motion, a slippery patch of oil or ice

Slumber.name: Slumber
Slumber.description:
Slumber

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Slumber]{here}.

Rank: Seasoned

Power Points: 2

Range: Smarts

Duration: One hour

School: Enchantment

Trappings: A lullaby, blowing powder or sand at targets.

Those who favor stealth or want to avoid harming their foes are drawn to this spell, which puts its victims into a deep and restful sleep.

Anyone affected by slumber must make a Spirit roll (at −2 if the caster got a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise} on her arcane skill roll). Those who fail fall asleep for the Duration of the spell. Very loud noises or attempts to physically wake a sleeper (by shaking him, for example), grant another Spirit roll.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Area of Effect (+2/+3): For +2 points the power affects everyone in a Medium Blast Template. For +3 points the @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{area of effect} is increased to a Large Blast Template.
Slumber.trapping: A lullaby, blowing powder or sand at targets

Smite.name: Smite
Smite.description:
Smite

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Smite]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: 2

Range: Smarts

Duration: 5

School: Transmutation

Trappings: A colored glow, runes, sigils, crackling energy, barbs grow from the blade.

This power is cast on a weapon of some sort. If it’s a ranged weapon, it affects one entire magazine, 20 bolts, shells, or arrows, or one full “load” of ammunition (the GM determines the exact quantity for unusual weapons). While the power is in effect, the weapon’s damage is increased by +2, or +4 with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}.

Limitations: In the case of smite with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05trappings00000]{Personal Limitation}, “Self” refers to the specific weapon instead.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Additional Recipients (+1): The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional Power Point each.
  • GREATER SMITE (+2): The weapon’s damage is increased by +4, or +6 damage with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise} and is considered a Heavy Weapon.
Smite.trapping: A colored glow, runes, sigils, crackling energy, barbs grow from the blade

Sound/Silence.name: Sound/Silence
Sound/Silence.description:
Sound/silence

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Sound/Silence]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: 1

Range: Smarts ×5 (sound); Smarts (silence)

Duration: Instant (sound); 5 (silence)

School: Illusion

Trappings: Magical effects, a brief ripple in the air, a bell or chime that starts or stops ringing.

Sound mimics any known sound or voice, emanating from a point of origin within Range at a volume up to the sound of a loud shout. If used as a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Test}, the defender @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{opposes} the casting roll with @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Smarts}.

Silence does the opposite, muting all sound up to a loud shout within a Large Blast Template. This subtracts 4 from @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Notice]{Notice} rolls made by those inside the area of effect, as well as anyone trying to hear sounds made from within. A @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise} completely mutes all sound inside the template (note that sound is usually required to cast spells).

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Greater SOUND/SILENCE (+1): The Smarts roll made to resist a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Test} (or Targeted modifier) is made at −2.
  • Mobile (+1): The caster can move the area of effect up to his arcane skill die type each round.
  • Targeted (+0): Instead of casting silence in an area of effect, the caster may instead target individuals in @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{Range} for 1 @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Point} each. Unwilling targets resist with @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Spirit} (at −2 if the caster gets a raise).
Sound/Silence.trapping: Magical effects, a brief ripple in the air, a bell or chime that starts or stops ringing

Speak Language.name: Speak Language
Speak Language.description:
Speak Language

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Speak Language]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: 1

Range: Smarts

Duration: 10 minutes

School: Divination

Trappings: Words, pictures, hand motions.

This power allows a character to speak, read, and write a sapient language other than his own. A @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise} on the arcane skill roll allows the user to appropriately use and understand slang and dialect as well.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Additional Recipients (+1): The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Points} each.
  • Greater Speak Language (+2): The recipient can speak, read, and write all sapient languages at once.
  • MASS UNDERSTANDING (+5): The recipient causes characters within @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Smarts} ×2 of him to understand one another, regardless of language.

Stun.name: Stun
Stun.description:
Stun

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Stun]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: 2

Range: Smarts

Duration: Instant

School: Evocation

Trappings: Bolts of energy, stun bombs, sonic booms, burst of blinding light.

Stun shocks a target with concussive force, sound, light, magical energy, or the like.

A successful casting means the victim must make a Vigor roll (at −2 with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise} on the arcane skill roll) or be @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Stunned}.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Area of Effect (+2/+3): For +2 points the power affects everyone in a Medium Blast Template. For +3 points the area of effect is increased to a Large Blast Template. See area effect attacks @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{here}.
Stun.trapping: Bolts of energy, stun bombs, sonic booms, burst of blinding light

Summon Ally.name: Summon Ally
Summon Ally.description:
Summon Ally
Rank Cost Servant
Novice 2 Attendant
Seasoned 4 Bodyguard
Veteran 6 Mirror Self*
Heroic 8 Sentinel

*Mirror Self costs +2 power points per Rank above Veteran to a maximum of 10 PPs at Legendary.

Attendant

See actor @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-actors.Summon Ally: Attendant]{here}.

Attributes: Agility d4, Smarts d4, Spirit d4, Strength d4, Vigor d4

Skills: Athletics d4, Fighting d4, Notice d4, Shooting d4, Stealth d6

Pace: 4; Parry: 4; Toughness: 4

Special Abilities:

  • @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Claws]{Claw}: Str+d4.
  • @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Construct]{Construct}: +2 to recover from being Shaken; ignore 1 point of Wound penalties; doesn’t breathe, immune to poison and disease.
  • @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Fearless]{Fearless}: Immune to fear and Intimidation.

Bodyguard

See actor @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-actors.Summon Ally: Bodyguard]{here}.

Attributes: Agility d6, Smarts d4, Spirit d6, Strength d6, Vigor d6

Skills: Athletics d6, Fighting d6, Intimidation d6, Notice d4, Shooting d4, Stealth d4

Pace: 6; Parry: 5; Toughness: 7 (2)

Edges: First Strike

Gear: Melee attack (Str+d6).

Special Abilities:

  • @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Armor]{Armor} +2: Hardened skin.
  • @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Construct]{Construct}: See Attendant.
  • @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Fearless]{Fearless}: Immune to fear and Intimidation.

Mirror Self

The ally is a clone of the caster except: it’s an @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Extra}; it has the same number of current Power Points as the caster after subtracting for this casting; it cannot use the summon ally power; its skills (but not attributes) are one die type less (minimum d4) than the original; it has identical mundane equipment (no magical qualities, disappears when the power expires); has the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Construct]{Construct} and @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Fearless]{Fearless} abilities.

Sentinel

See actor @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-actors.Summon Ally: Sentinel]{here}.

Attributes: Agility d6, Smarts d6, Spirit d8, Strength d12+2, Vigor d10

Skills: Athletics d6, Fighting d10, Intimidation d10, Notice d8

Pace: 6; Parry: 7; Toughness: 13 (4)

Edges: Arcane Resistance, Sweep (Imp).

Gear: Melee attack (Str+d8).

Special Abilities:

  • @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Armor]{Armor} +4: Stone skin.
  • @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Construct]{Construct}: See Attendant.
  • @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Fearless]{Fearless}: Immune to fear and Intimidation.
  • @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Size]{Size} 2: Sentinels are 8’ tall and very dense.

Summon Ally

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Summon Ally]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: Special

Range: Smarts

Duration: 5

School: Conjuration

Trappings: Clay figure that grows into a servant, a tattoo that comes to life.

This power allows the character to summon a magical servant from nothing. The ally typically takes the form of a basic humanoid of the appropriate Size but can appear differently based on the caster’s Trappings. It materializes anywhere in Range, and with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise} on the arcane skill roll, it’s @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Resilient]{Resilient} as well.

The ally acts on its creator’s @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Action Card} and follows her commands to the best of its ability. It has no personality, creativity, or emotions. When the power ends or the ally is @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Incapacitated}, it fades into nothingness, leaving no trace behind.

The type of servant that can be summoned depends on the caster’s Rank. With the GM’s approval, the player may swap abilities. If a hero wants an attendant in the form of a wolf, for example, the caster might exchange the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Shooting]{Shooting} skill for @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Survival]{Survival} so that the “animal” can track its foes.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Additional Allies (Varies): Additional allies of the same type may be summoned at the same time for half the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Points} cost of the original summons (total cost including modifiers, rounded up).
  • Bite/Claw (+1): The ally can Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Bite]{Bite} or @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Claws]{claw} at Str+d6.
  • Combat Edge (+1): The ally has a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01edgesummarie00]{Combat Edge} (it must meet the Requirements as usual). You may take this modifier up to three times per ally.
  • Flight (+2): The ally can fly at Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.Movement]{Pace} 12.
  • Increased Trait (+1): The caster can increase a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Trait} one die type for one @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Point}. She may do this for as many Traits as she likes, but only once per Trait.
  • Mind Rider (+1): The caster can communicate and sense through the ally.
Summon Ally.trapping: Clay figure that grows into a servant, a tattoo that comes to life.

Telekinesis.name: Telekinesis
Telekinesis.description:
Telekinesis

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Telekinesis]{here}.

Rank: Seasoned

Power Points: 5

Range: Smarts ×2

Duration: 5

School: Transmutation

Trappings: A wave of the hand, magic wand, steely gaze.

Telekinesis is the ability to move objects or creatures (including oneself) with arcane will. It has a Strength of d10, or d12 with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}.

Unwilling opponents resist the caster’s arcane skill with an @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{opposed} @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Spirit} roll when targeted and at the start of each of their turns afterward until they’re released. They can be moved up to the caster’s @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Smarts} per turn in any direction, and can be bashed into walls, ceilings, or other obstacles for Str+d6 damage.

Dropped creatures suffer falling damage as usual.

Telekinetic Tools: A caster can wield tools (including weapons) with telekinesis as an action. Use the caster’s relevant skill when attacking in this way (not his arcane skill).

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Power (+3): The Strength of telekinesis is d12, or d12+2 with a raise. Bashing victims inflicts Str+d6 damage. Objects weighing 1,000 pounds or more are treated as @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{Heavy Weapons}.
Telekinesis.trapping: A wave of the hand, magic wand, steely gaze

Teleport.name: Teleport
Teleport.description:
Teleport

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Teleport]{here}.

Rank: Seasoned

Power Points: 2

Range: Smarts

Duration: Instant

School: Conjuration

Trappings: A cloud of smoke, “phasing” out, change into a bolt of lightning.

Teleport allows a character to disappear and instantly reappear up to 12″ (24 yards) distant, or double that with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}.

Opponents adjacent to a character who teleports away don’t get a free attack (see @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Withdrawing From Melee}).

If casting teleport on willing subjects, the caster decides where they move to, not the targets.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Additional Recipients (+1): The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional Power Point each.
  • Gate (+5): Instead of teleporting, the caster opens a temporary portal connecting her current location and the destination. Creatures and objects can travel through this gate from either side for 5 rounds.
  • Greater Teleport (+5): The character can teleport much farther. The caster must concentrate on her destination for at least one round, taking no other actions. This makes her @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Vulnerable}; if @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Shaken} or @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Stunned}, the spell fails.
    For one round of concentration, the character can teleport up to 100 miles. For two rounds, she can travel 1000 miles, and with three rounds, she can go anywhere on Golarion.
    If you've physically been there yourself, there is no modifier to your roll. With success you arrive within 2d6  x 10 feet of your target, or on target with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}.
    If you have a detailed map or have seen it through a power or device, you suffer a –2 to the roll. With success you arrive within 2d6 x 100 feet, or on target with a raise.
    If you have a crude map or a general notion of the place on a regional or world map, you suffer a –4. You arrive within 2d10 miles with success, or within 2d6 x 100 feet with a raise.
    In the absence of such information, teleporting is not possible.
    A @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Critical Failure} transports the recipient to a random location (GM’s call) on the same plane of existence.
  • Teleport Foe (+2): Foes may be targeted by a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Touch} attack. This is an action, which must be the second part of a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Multi-Action} if the attack is successful. The foe resists the casting with an opposed Spirit roll against the arcane skill total and is sent up to 12″ away with success and 24″ with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}. Foes may not be teleported into solid objects.
Teleport.trapping: A cloud of smoke, "phasing" out, change into a bolt of lightning

Time Stop.name: Time Stop
Time Stop.description:
Time Stop

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Time Stop]{here}.

Rank: Heroic

Power Points: 8

Range: Self

Duration: Instant

School: Transmutation

Trappings: A glowing hourglass, floating ice particles, blurring.

Time is a constant for most, but not this spellcaster. The spell slows time for all but the caster, granting her a new turn immediately after she finishes this one. With a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}, she gets up to four actions on the turn instead of three and can ignore up to 2 points of @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Multi-Action} penalties. Time stop can only be cast once per round.
Time Stop.trapping: A glowing hourglass, floating ice particles, blurring.

Wall Walker.name: Wall Walker
Wall Walker.description:
Wall Walker

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Wall Walker]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: 2

Range: Smarts

Duration: 5

School: Transmutation

Trappings: Spider-like visage, prickly hairs on hands and feet.

Wall walker allows the recipient to walk on vertical or horizontal surfaces. With success, she moves at half her normal Pace. With a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}, she may move at full Pace and even run.

If forced to make an @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Athletics]{Athletics} roll to climb or hang on to a surface, she adds +4 to the total.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Additional Recipients (+1): The caster may affect others at the cost of 1 @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Point} each.
Wall Walker.trapping: Spider-like visage, prickly hairs on hands and feet

Warrior's Gift.name: Warrior's Gift
Warrior's Gift.description:
Warrior's Gift

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Warrior's Gift]{here}.

Rank: Seasoned

Power Points: 4

Range: Smarts

Duration: 5

School: Conjuration

Trappings: Gestures, prayer, whispered words, concentration.

With a successful arcane skill roll, the recipient gains the benefits of a single Combat Edge chosen by the caster. The caster (not the recipient) must have the same Rank or higher as the Edge’s Requirements. With a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}, the recipient gains the Improved version of the Edge (if there is one, and even if he doesn’t meet the Rank Requirement).

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Additional Recipients (+1): The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Point} each.
  • Power (+4): The recipient gains two Combat Edges at once.

Wish.name: Wish
Wish.description:
Wish

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Wish]{here}.

Rank: Legendary

Power Points: 20

Range: Smarts

Duration: Instant

School: Universal

Trappings: A jinn from a bottle, clicked heels, an incantation, a monkey’s paw.

Wish allows a character to bend reality to his will. It is taxing to alter reality, however, so the caster must permanently sacrifice 3 of his own Power Points (after the spell is cast). A @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise} on the arcane skill roll eliminates this cost.

A caster may wish for any one of the following effects per casting, chosen before the roll is made:

  • Activate a Power: Wish casts any other available power, including modifiers, available in the campaign with a raise. If the spell is @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{opposed}, the target rolls with a −2 penalty on top of any other modifiers. If the Power Points required to activate the power and modifiers are greater than the cost of wish, the caster must pay the difference.
  • Intercession: The caster wishes for some form of aid, which typically appears after a short period of time. A party trapped in a collapsed dungeon might wish for escape only to be rescued by a party of dwarven miners. A spellcaster could wish to know the true name of a powerful demon and be contacted the next day by a traitorous subordinate of the creature.
  • Gain an Edge: The caster can gain (or grant another) a permanent @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01edges000000000]{Edge}. The recipient must meet the Edge’s Requirements and can never gain more than one Edge from a wish.
  • Wealth: The spellcaster wishes for up to 10,000 gp worth of goods, including anything from transportation to supplies to magic items. Such goods generally sell for a quarter of their value. The wealth doesn’t appear from nothing but rather comes to the caster via events contrived by the GM.
  • Travel Back Through Time: The caster travels back in time for a short period: one minute outside of combat or back to the start of the current round in combat. Everything that happened in that period is reversed except for the caster's @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Points}, @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Bennies}, and @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Wounds}.
    The GM should do her best to remember all other actors' state of things from the start of the round, but warping time is imperfect so don't worry about getting everything exactly right.
    Once reversed, only the caster remembers the alternate sequence of events, and that period of time cannot be altered again.
  • See the Future: The caster peers into the near or far future. A look into the near future grants her three @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Conviction} tokens that must be used by the caster or anyone she's currently in contact with (mental, verbal, in sight, etc.) within the next five rounds. At the end of the fifth round, any remaining tokens are discarded. A look into the far future allows the caster to ask the Game Master one question about the future and receive as accurate an answer as possible. Actions by the spellcaster can change the future, however, so this may only be the most likely path or a warning of future dangers.
  • Raise a Trait: Wish can permanently increase a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Trait} one die type. This increases the Trait’s limit by one die type as well. A recipient may never have more than one Trait raised by a wish.
  • Restore Fate: The hero and all @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Wild Cards} in @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{Range} may refill their @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Bennies} to their usual starting maximum.
  • Special: The character may change relatively minor aspects of herself, others, or the world around her (if the subject of the wish doesn’t want to be affected, it’s resisted with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Spirit} roll at −2). This shouldn’t cause any far-reaching changes to the world or history, shouldn’t be covered by one of the abilities above, and is completely at the whim of the Game Master. A caster can change her gender, ancestry, languages, etc., but these changes do not alter time and are thus not retroactive.
    Wish can improve someone’s mood (and their attitude on the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-tables.Reaction]{Reaction Table}, if appropriate), but it can’t permanently affect free will. It can’t force a change of heart or make someone harm themselves.
Wish.trapping: Carving symbols on corpses, throwing bones, graveyards, "leather" books

Zombie.name: Zombie
Zombie.description:
Zombie Creatures

Animals and other creatures can also be raised with this foul ability! The cost is 2 for a creature of Size -1 or -1, 3 for Size 0, and 1 for a Small Swarm, 2 for a Medium Swarm, or 3 for a Large.

Larger creatures cost 3 + Size in Power Points. For example, and undead grizzly (Size 2) costs 5 Power Points to raise.

Magical or supernatural @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore08bestia.JournalEntryPage.08specialabili00]{Special Abilities} aren't conferred to the undead form, but those inherent to the creature are, such as @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Improved Frenzy]{Improved Frenzy}, @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{Reach}, a swarm's attack, etc.

Additional zombie creatures cost half their base cost if raised at once, instead of the +1 listed for Additional Zombies (round up, minimum of 1).

Zombie

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Zombie]{here}.

Rank: Veteran

Power Points: 3 (See sidebar for large creatures)

Range: Smarts

Duration: One hour

School: Necromancy

Trappings: Carving symbols on corpses, throwing bones, graveyards.

Zombie grants animation and basic intelligence to the remains of a once-living being. The summoned horror is obedient but literal-minded in its duties. It isn’t telepathic, and must be controlled by voice.

The being has the physical skills it had in life, but its Smarts, Spirit, and related skills are reset to d4. A @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise} on the casting roll increases any one of their Traits one die type (caster’s choice).

See @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-actors.Zombie, Human]{here} for the standard profile of a human zombie. Corpses aren’t summoned by this ability, so there must actually be a supply of bodies in @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{Range} (GM’s call).

An undead @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Incapacitated} by damage can’t be raised with this power again.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Additional Zombies (+1): A larger horde can be raised in a single casting by paying an additional 1 @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Point} for each extra zombie raised.
  • Armed (+1 per Zombie): The dead rise with a weapon common to their background or environment. Choose one:
    • Hand Weapon: Str+d6.
    • Ranged Weapon: Range 12/24/48, Damage 2d6.
  • Armor (+1 per Zombie): The horrors crawl from their grave wearing 2 points of Armor. This might be old chain mail, rusting plate, rotting leather, etc.
  • Mind Rider (+1/+3): The caster can communicate and sense through one of the undead he’s conjured. If it’s destroyed, he may jump to any of the others currently under his control. For 3 points, Mind Rider affects all the zombies created in this summoning.
  • Permanent (0): The zombie is given unlife until Incapacitated by @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Wounds}. The Power Points used to raise it are “invested” and unavailable until it’s destroyed.
